intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis rictoria, commonly known as the Rictoria orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, showy blooms in shades of white, yellow, and green, which are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Pleurothallis rictoria is appreciated by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
